what else do i need to add if you are interview me as a startup head hunter for vp RND

As a startup headhunter interviewing you for a VP R&D role, here are some additional points that you might want to consider adding to your CV or discussing in the interview:

1. Key achievements: Highlight your most significant accomplishments and outcomes, such as successfully launching a new product or service, increasing revenue, reducing costs, or improving team productivity. These metrics can help demonstrate your ability to drive results.
2. Technical skills: Be sure to showcase your technical expertise and experience working with various software, programming languages, and tools relevant to the role. This information can help demonstrate your ability to lead a technical team effectively.
3. Management experience: Discuss your previous management roles, highlighting your experience leading and mentoring technical teams. You should also discuss your leadership style, including how you handle conflict resolution and motivate team members.
4. Innovation: As a VP R&D, you will be expected to drive innovation and foster a culture of experimentation and risk-taking. Be prepared to discuss your approach to innovation, including any successful initiatives you have led in the past.
5. Industry knowledge: As a senior leader in the organization, you will need to have a deep understanding of the industry and market trends. Demonstrate your knowledge of the market, competitors, and emerging technologies in your field.
6. Communication skills: Effective communication is essential in any leadership role. Be sure to discuss your communication skills, highlighting your ability to present complex technical information to non-technical stakeholders and your experience in building strong relationships with customers, partners, and investors.
7. Adaptability: Startups are often fast-paced, and priorities can change quickly. Highlight your experience in adapting to new challenges and your ability to pivot when necessary.

By discussing these points and showcasing your relevant experience, skills, and achievements, you can demonstrate your suitability for the VP R&D role and increase your chances of landing the job.
